Our Latest News

See what’s happening across all Stewart Companies business units

  • All
  • News

SkillsUSA Pennsylvania Masonry Competition

Jun 18, 2019

April 24, 2019 For over 15 years, York Building Products has been providing concrete block to the SkillsUSA Pennsylvania Masonry Competition. The event, held at the Lebanon Valley Expo Center, is a hands-on competition among PA vo-tech masonry students. Other trades that compete are carpentry, plumbing, electrical, mechanical, and computer sciences. This year, 13 masonry…

Read More →

Lewis Contractors Continues to Build a Better Baltimore: Breaking Ground on Brooks Robinson Field in West Baltimore

Jun 18, 2019

April 24, 2019 Lewis Contractors’ decade-long relationship with the Cal Ripken, Sr. Foundation continues as crews broke ground this month to construct a low maintenance synthetic turf baseball field on the grounds of Frederick Douglass High School in west Baltimore. As with all of the previous fields completed by Lewis, the new Brooks Robinson Field…

Read More →

Project Underway at York Catholic High School

Jun 3, 2019

June 3, 2019 York Catholic High School commemorated the start of construction on Phase I of its capital campaign project with a groundbreaking ceremony on May 29. Stewart & Tate Construction of York will begin work on the project which will involve renovating two floors of classrooms and adding air conditioning to the school located…

Read More →

Greiner Advanced Manufacturing Center

May 30, 2019

May 30, 2019 The Greiner Advanced Manufacturing Center at Thaddeus Stevens College of Techology in Lancaster, PA, was recently completed and feaures our Titan Series® units in a custom color on the exterior, and our Gemstone Plus® units in White in the interior. The official opening of the building will be Fall 2019. The educational…

Read More →

Stewart & Tate Awarded Contract for New Retail Project in Springettsbury Township

May 30, 2019

May 30, 2019 Stewart & Tate Construction of York, PA, has been awarded a contract by Quattro Development LLC of Oak Brook, IL, for sitework and construction at the developer’s retail project on the east side of Mount Zion Road, between Concord Road and the Route 30 eastbound entrance. Stewart & Tate will be performing…

Read More →

Stewart & Tate Completes New Research and Innovation Center for Carlisle Construction Materials

May 30, 2019

May 30, 2019 Stewart & Tate Construction recently completed a 42,000 SF Research and Innovation Center for Carlisle Construction Materials. The building replaces the current Tech Center Building and houses testing labs, support offices, and conference and collaboration spaces. The structure was designed to add a second story over the front office area for future…

Read More →

Lewis Contractors Hosts Hard Hat Tour at Port Discovery Children’s Museum

May 30, 2019

May 30, 2019 Lewis Contractors and the AIA Baltimore Historic Resources Committee were pleased to host a Hard Hat Tour of the new Port Exhibit and new SkyClimber at Port Discovery Children’s Museum. Lewis Contractors, selected as the Construction Manager for the project, is working in collaboration with Architects Cambridge Seven Associates to oversee the…

Read More →

American Flag Flown Over the 9/11 Memorial in New York City to Hang in Cockeysville, MD, Facility

Apr 25, 2019

April 25, 2019 An American flag that has flown over the 9/11 Memorial in New York City has been hung in YBP’s newly renovated production facility in Cockeysville, MD, to honor and respect the lives lost on that fateful day. Plant employees appreciate what it stands for, and are proud to have it hanging in…

Read More →

Stewart & Tate to Build Fitness Studio in Gettysburg

Apr 24, 2019

April 24, 2019 Stewart & Tate Construction has been awarded a contract for the construction and related sitework of a new exercise facility to be located at Proline Place in Straban Township, Gettysburg. The exterior of the 3,293 SF building, designed by KD3 Design Studio, will feature stone and board and batten siding in order…

Read More →

Masonry Construction Job Fair

Apr 1, 2019

On Wednesday, March 13, Rick Miller and Doug Sheaffer represented York Building Products at the Masonry Construction Job Fair and Industry Advisory Committee meeting at Thaddeus Stevens College of Technology. The event was held at the college’s Masonry Construction lab. Industry representatives were able to see the Masonry Construction hands-on labs and some of the…

Read More →
